newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent breaks above $20 on fund buying, technicals.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent breaks above $20 on fund buying, technicals.

text.p: IPE Brent crude oil futures blipped above $20 a barrel on Friday afternoon for the first time since March 21 as fund buying pushed up paper markets in London and New York, dealers said.
By 1715 gmt the July contract was at $19.94 a barrel, up 45 cents, having been up above the $20 mark moments before. NYMEX front month crude was at $21.85, up 55 cents on the day.
The startling rise came after a day of very thin trade in London. "WTI (NYMEX crude) broke through $21.55, which was Monday's high, and we've seen some good buying by the banks," said one trader.
This year Brent prices have fallen from a high of $24.91 on January 9 to a low of $17.54 on April 10.
Since then prices have rallied, reaching $19.89 on Monday, another resistance level broken through this afternoon.
Brokers said NYMEX gasoline contract's break through the $65.20 resistance level added to the flurry of buying.
